reviews.review: e bom!

Ho giocato questo titolo moti anni dopo la sua uscita , devo dire che mi ha colpito per la sua eccezionale atmosfera di fanta mistero , una cosa interessante inoltre e che passerete molto tempo non ad uccidere i nemici , ma alla ricerca della strada giusta per proseguire. La grafica e decisamente buona e ancora più che accettabile al momento della stesura di questa recensione ,  il numero di poligoni e elevato e gli effetti grafici sono di ottima qualità , il sonoro e appagante .
Il degno seguito di una pietra miliare degli shooter in prima persona.

the best game ive ever played. if you like action play this game!!!!!!!!!!!

Best Game of 2004. Even better than the first HL, wow I didn't think it was possible. While it is a shooter, it involves a lot more gameplay types, it allows you to drive through to point A-B with intense action, areas where you need to sneak past, you get to control troops of rebels (and even antlions at one point). And the regular shooting is great, it's also a true sequel meaning it's just a bunch of higher tech HL. (with the same physics puzzles and similar gameplay) It also has one of the best sci-fi storyline's of the century, including characters, dialog, and of course just story in general. It introduces a new gun that is just OMG, try launching a paint can at something, see how much damage that will cause. Just amazing, like HL1, I really have NOTHING negative to say.

Rated: 10/10

This is best singleplayer game of all time period. 10/10 Gameplay and story are perfectly woven together into an intricate masterpiece that stands the test of time. The graphics of the source engine are still up to par for something that came out in 2004. The two episodes never break in its stride and are a rock solid continuation of its story. ValvE have never let us down and this is was thier crowning achievement. Lets hope they do it again. 

So do i reccomend this game?

Yes, a thousand times yes.

HL2 is something different from HL1. Obviously the graphics are better for starters, but most important, both are two different games. I found HL1 to be more similar to a Metroid game, whle HL2 is more action packed and a more true FPS. One thing is for sure; they are both great games.

What is there to say about Half-Life 2? Saying it was good, would be a waste of the entire internets time. So here's a more detailed description: This is a game that is still generaly better than most games made from 2012 onward. I never was a full PC gamer untill around 2010, and by then I played most triple A games that were available to me on console. Half-Life2 is a great game even if you like most generic money grabbing piles of arse. This game has something for just about everybody. If you like a good FPS, this is your game. If you like a good horror game, this is your game. If you want a puzzle game, this is the game for you. This game was made in 2006, and was around 6 years ahead of its time. The physics engine does its job and there's enough things that either fly out at you in the dark, shoot at you for not "picking up that can" (:D) and areas of the game that require skill and stratergy. Not so less that its to easy, and not so much to feel impossible. The story line of this game is overall entertaining and great. If you want to know who Gordon Freeman (the primary protagonist) is, here's a quick rundown: Gordon Freeman is a silent protagonist, wait come back, here's where it gets interesting. The involment of the game is dependant on the player entirely! During the start of game, you could be a guy, who has been sent into the furutre to kill John Conne- I mean, Alyx Vance. The dialog is enough to envolve you but not so much that you feel like the massive hero who immortal! No. The game's story revolves around who the player wants Gordon Freeman to be, thus creating the best video game character who ever existed, because of vanity reasons. So lets get onto graphics, 2006 THE END. No just kidding, Being a PC gamer faced with Alpha's and other games who dont have great graphics so they dont matter to me. They're good enough to see what you have to kill and who you are, also: NOT USING THE SAME (BLEEP)ING TEXTURE ON WALLS MAKING (BLEEP) CONFUSING! Anyway, my overall review score is 96/100 (same meta-score but then again the only game to get 100/100 in my opinion is Portal, so yeah)

Half Life 2 is nothing short of a revolutionary game for the time. Everything from the riding into city 17 on that train to the end of the game keeps you consistently engaged and always moving to the next point. To keep this brief, Half Life 2 deserves it's title as one of the greatest games of all time and deserves all the praise it has gotten over the years.

pick up that can

What can I say about this game? The story, and the action is breathtaking. It must've looked amazing for computers and early consoles back in 2004. It pans very well on how Gorden tries to survive with his life and stop the forces. There was a light glitch that totally ruined the game for me, fortunattly, some die-hard fans found a way around it, and now it works like a charm. I would normally add something like that for negative points, but I'll let it go for now. If Valve decides to fix it up at last, I'll give them the benefit of praise.
The music... shaddup and take my money it's AWESOME.
The aiming on the hoverboat was kinda hard, but I guess that's just me. May take some time to get used to.
Overall, the game is fun, addictive, and what you may expect in a movie. Not just shoot shoot shoot like in Call of Duty or whatever. You hafta shoot your guns, and solve ways on how to proceede further into the game.

To end this, I'm giving this game a 9/10 score.

not only do i feel this is the best game of all time but it makes you feel like a normal man defying the odds against an unbeatable force till the end. the story is also very dynamic leaving you with more unanswered questions of why the things happen as they do who is the mysterious man in the suit who is he working for as you see him everywere as you play on which not only fuels you to play on to find the truth but always leaves you with even more questions after you find another answer and always ends at a cliff hanger making you hungry for more in this epic tale of the freeman. best to play the first half life to understand the whole story.
Love all hal life games

This game is very fun to play, the gravity gun alone is fun to use but the only thing I hate about this game is the sticky allies. I can't count how many times they have gotten me killed because the follow one step behind you. If an enemy appears I am unable to back step or get behind cover because I am blocked by a so called ally..... it is annoying but over all this is a great first person shooter.

Half-Life 2 is, without hyberbole, the single greatest video game ever made. It is a paragon of interactive storytelling, a master of the shooter genre, and a truly unparalleled experience. There is no reason not to play this game.
Just pure awesomeness!

Difficile dire qualcosa su questo gioco che non sia stata già detta in 10 anni. E' un'esperienza ludica ancor oggi BELLISSIMA, e un riferimento importante per tutti gli FPS realizzati successivamente. Consiglio di godere ogni angolo di questo meraviglioso mondo virtuale, senza fretta.

Ci sono fasi per tutti i gusti: horror, puzzle, belliche, stealth, al chiuso, all'aperto, di giorno, di notte. La cura nei particolari è maniacale e i comandi perfetti. Voto: 9.7/10

There's not much that can be said about this game that hasn't been already shouted out a thousand times. All in all the game and it's engine have aged beautifully. I still think the game looks perfect in comparison with the most recent releases. And the story; it's a seller - it grasps you like no other. But the best part about this game is the solid, easy, fun and addicting gameplay.

And what about the replay value, you might ask? Well the game is filled with easter eggs and secrets for you to find if you're into digging around a bit. I sure am since I've collected all the Steam achievements this game had to offer. Lot's of fun!
Best game ever! It exceeded my expectations of an awesome game! I would recommend this to lovers of strategy and action!

[h1]1,2+1,8= ?[/h1]

I had the opportunity to play a bunch of epic single player masterpieces, either in console and pc like Shadow of the Colossus, BioShock, Red dead Redemption, GTA SA, TW3 and many others,  but this game might be the best one...

[h1]Pros:[/h1]
[list]
[*]Even it's a 2004 game, the graphics aged very well.
[*]Still one of the best physics in AAA games aside with portal [spoiler]Only losing for GTA4 IMO[/spoiler].
[*]You pass for so many places and do so many things that you really don't care about the linearity of the game. 
[*]Epic and really solid gameplay.
[*]Epic History, and how it is shown to you
[*]Good AI.
[*]Amazing soundtrack
[*]Almost all characters are very well worked, EVEN YOU saying anything.
[*]BEST IMMERSION OF ALL GAMES. I'll explain this later on this review.
[*]Gravity Gun "the Zero Point Energy Field Manipulator if you really want to."
[/list]
[h1]Cons:[/h1]
[list]
[*]THE FIRST 2~3 CHAPTERS CAN BE BORING AND MAKE YOU QUIT THE GAME IF YOU DIDN'T PLAYED/KNOW THE HISTORY OF THE FIRST GAME SO BE AWARE OF IT.
[*]Some people might think or complain about a lack of enemy types, and it does, but the way how the battles happens easily covers it.
[*]Barney. (LUL)
[/list]

The game have chapters, but when you finish, it appears like you played a long and epic journey AND IT IS [spoiler] (only ravenholm MIGHT chage this) [/spoiler]. You can see the sadness and the pain on the peoples face in the start, and they see you coming back, the legend himself,  your presence give them strength to fight again, maybe the last hope. With many memorable momentes such  as [spoiler]THE FUCKING BRIDGE[/spoiler] and the [spoiler]Strider battle square[/spoiler], the pace of the game pull you in a boss mode, who resolve and/or destroy everything (almost) that comes.

My favorite SP game of all time.

SCORE:10/10
